metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11662 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: The _WM_ParseNewMidi function in f_midi.c in WildMIDI 0.4.2 can cause a denial of service (invalid memory read and application crash) via a crafted mid file. It was discovered that WildMIDI incorrectly handled certain MID files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

notes.Note: ebarretto> Looking at the patches and the version on Trusty, it seems like some of the patches are not appliable and others are tricky to backport. So considering really low for Trusty.

criterions.comment: wildmidi package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.2-1').
